inn1.comm: full and nibbling away a touch outside off, Amla watches it through to Wade
pitched further up and angled in, Amla blocks it to short extra cover. Solid
full and outside off, left alone. The carry is far from encouraging

shoots low, big appeal for lbw, umpire Wilson does not budge. Smith does not opt for a review. Full and moves in to catch the pad in front of the leg stump. It was probably grazing leg or going down with the angle. Umpire's call would have prevailed, I suppose
fuller and outside off, neatly pushed to mid-off
full and around off, does not come on to Amla. Wafty drive to mid-off. Hazlewood opens with a maiden
length and outside off, pushed to mid-off
full and angling outside off, Qdk pokes and manages an inside edge onto the pad
a tad overpitched and outside off, Qdk steps forward and smoothly drives it past the bowler, beats mid-off to his left. Nice and crisp....
back of a length, NCN drags his length back and gets it to slant away past the outside edge of the groping bat
back of a length on off, dropped defensively to the right of short cover
back of a length and around off, tapped through midwicket
fuller and outside off, run down to third man
fullish and angling away from Qdk, he shuffles across and works it defensively to the leg side
fuller and outside off, clipped out to midwicket. Shuffles across and nurdles it
pitched up and outside off, driven straight to mid-off
full and angled in on off and middle, the left-hander covers up in defence
dug in outside off, shovelled to the man at mid-on
half-volley slipping down leg, Amla can't glance it away. Beaten
shot! Short and width outside off, Amla waits, gets on top of the bounce, slapping it with the wrists to the left of diving backward point
back of a length and angled in on off, Amla stands tall and punchily defends to short extra cover
shorter and outside off, does not come onto the bat, Amla hangs back and rides it down to third man
pitched up on the off stump, the left-hander shows the full face of the bat and push-drives it straight down the ground. Minimal followthrough
full and aimed at off, Amla looks to drive and toe-ends it to mid-off
overpitched on middle, serene drive to mid-on
short and angled around off from round the stumps, open-faced glide to point
full and angled in on the off stump, Qdk inches forward and blocks it to short extra cover
back of a length and comes in on off, Qdk does not cover the movement, ends up poking it back to the bowler via an inside edge
full and outside off, Qdk leans back and chops a single down to third man
back of a length and around off, Amla plays it up to short extra cover
raps the pad outside the line of off. Amla walks across off aiming for a whip over midwicket and misses
full and angling down leg, wide
short and outside off, helped down to third man
back of a length and on off, nudged straight to square leg
full and outside off, pushed to the covers
too full and straight, Qdk picks it up and dispatches it over midwicket. Puts the bad ball way. He sent his pick-up shots flying at the IPL for Daredevils
NCN angles in a short ball and tucks the batsman up for room. Qdk stabs and chops it onto the ground off a thick inside edge that bounces over the stumps. Nearly dragged on
width outside off, Qdk slashes and gets an edge that would have lodged into the hands of first slip. He isn't there. Instead, rolls to third man for four
full and angled in, Amla sits back and nurdles a single to square leg
picked away off the pads... straight to short fine leg

full and angled in to catch the pad from round the stumps. Qdk flicks and misses/may have tickled it. The umpire - Wilson - gives it as runs. Smith has a chat with Wade and goes for a review. The on-field call is not out. I can't spot an inside snick. There isn't enough evidence actually. There was a noise, but it probably came from the ball hitting the front pad and then the back pad. Impact in line, the tracker shows that it would have hit the leg stump. Umpire Wilson's call is reversed. TV umpire Llong rules it out. Coach Domingo and debutant Shami look puzzled in the SA change room. Qdk has to go, though. Australia get the breakthrough!
full and angled in from round the wicket, inside-edged to mid-on
short and wide outside off, Rossouw frees his arms and cuts it firmly to the left of diving backward point. He gets off the mark with a crunched four
back of a length and angled in, blocked to short midwicket
dangled across off, Amla shuffles across off and nudges to short midwicket
shorter and outside off, chopped straight to point
whipped from outside off to short midwicket
slides on off, driven to mid-off
flicked off the off stump after shuffling across to short fine leg who fumbles
drifts on the off stump, dabbed wide of lone slip. Not much turn, but tight lines from Lyon
back of a length and outside off, Amla has all the time in the world to help it down to third man
chopped wide of point
full and floated wide outside off, Amla slashes and does not touch it. Wide
straying into the hips, whipped past backward square leg
a touch overpitched on off, free-flowing drive to mid-off
back of a length on off, leans back and chops it down to third man
back of a length on off, Amla bends and defends
turn! Pitches on off and breaks away, gingerly defended
full and keeps low on off, dabs it to Maxi at second slip who lets it through him
floated on off, driven firmly. Mitch Marsh throws himself to his right to stop the ball at mid-off
slides on middle, straight ball, nudged to leg

Rossouw presses forward and has been given out lbw by ump Illingworth. Looks adjacent. No inside snick there. Rossouw reviews. Not a good one. South Africa have lost their review. Another one that straightens, fuller in length, hit in front of middle. He pushed forward and did not touch it. The on-field call is vindicated
offbreak, heads down leg, AB stays back and nudges it fine on the leg side
skids on middle, punched back, Zampa dives to his left and deflects to short extra cover
slower through the air on middle, 76ks, dabbed back to Zampa
Amla bends and meets a full toss, scooped down to long leg. Toe-ended it
fuller on off, Amla pre-meditated by going low for a paddle-scoop. Deflects it wide of the keeper, behind square
long hop outside off, AB skips back and cracks it to sweeper cover
skids on off, AB gets forward and taps it to short extra cover
slapped from outside off, to long-on on the back foot
AB skips out and is deceived in flight. He adjusts and squirts it to the leg side
flat dart outside off, bottom-handed shovel to long-on
shorter and angled across off, chopped to sweeper cover
slides on off, AB presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
full and breaks in a touch to catch the pad outside off
flat legbreak, Amla steps back and whips past midwicket
tossed on off, AB drives it to the right of sweeper. AB wants two and gets it
full and straight, AB presses forward and bunts it to midwicket. No turn there
no turn again, skiddy short ball on off. AB stands tall and punches it past the covers
slipping down leg, errant ball, wide
dangled outside off, sliced square on the off side. This turned a bit and messed with Amla's drive
fired down leg, shovelled to fine leg
short and angled across, keeps low outside off. Swatted on the back foot to the midwicket region
slides on outside off, Amla leans into the drive and drives it sweetly past diving short extra cover. Twirled his wrists to place it to the left of the man there
full and straight, turned to square leg for one
flat and breaks in on the leg stump, flicked behind square leg
flat and pushed outside off, forced to sweeper cover on the back foot
AB shuffles across and forward to smother this full ball
lets rip a slider on off and middle, chopped through the covers. That kept alarmingly low
lovely legbreak, leaves AB and defeats him
straighter one, blocked on the front foot to short extra cover
floated outside off, AB attempts a sweep and hits it in the air.... Bounces in front of deep midwicket
turn and bounce! Legbreak nips away, Amla stays back gets on top of the bounce and guides it behind point
full on middle, knocked through mid-on
too full and outside off, Amla carves it to sweeper cover
AB shows his ace early and dances out. Marsh pulls his length back and keeps the advancing batsman to a defence
attempted short ball, keeps low outside off... He reaches out and steers to third man
full and attacking off, Amla shuffles across the stumps and nurdles it to square leg. Finch collects the ball quickly and does not effect a direct hit at the non-striker's end
back of a length, keeps low on off again. No bounce at all. Perhaps there is more life in Mars. Run down to third man
looks like an offcutter, AB pushes to mid-on
just skids on outside off, chopped on the back foot to sweeper cover
AB skips back and punches this one to point
slides on off, shovelled back to the bowler
tapped to short extra cover
full on off, square-driven for one
fired outside off, Amla sits back and clunks a cut to sweeper cover
too straight to Amla who will flick away all day/night to square leg for one
full, overly full, a bit of away shape and nicely driven to deep cover with a fluent drive
cross-seam fullish outside off, Amla dabs to third man with an angled bat. Really good
fuller than a good length and straight, blocked
slightly too straight again, enabling an easy flick but AB finds midwicket. A run missed
makes it up with an awesome single. Just a bunt to Maxwell at mid-on and AB called for one immediately. Made it with enviable ease

gone! Fantastic fielding from Steven Smith. Manufactures a wicket, and a massive one too. Amla run-out again. A darter outside off is punched to the left of Smith, who runs around and stops it in one swift motion. He has the presence of mind to realise it is Amla who is halfway down and returns a good throw to Finch who takes off the bails. Big, big, big, big wicket
some flight on off, driven to long-off with the spin
more flight outside off, JP hustles to the pitch to whip to long-on. Good intent
floated up on off, driven to cover
a bit leg side-ish, but AB is persistent on hitting with the spin so he steps outside leg to drive to cover
hardly any bounce. Flat outside off, slow, keeps slower of the pitch. AB pushes to long-off
a full toss on off, driven to long-on
flatter trajectory outside off, driven to cover
too much flight, too full. Drilled to long-off, with the spin, nicely played
flat on middle, AB goes pack to punch to long-on
nicely bowled, flight on middle and off. Blocked into the off side
excellent execution. Flat on middle, JP gets low and paddle reverse-sweeps past short third man. An easy three
more flight outside off, JP tries to open the face to find a gap at point but can't. Blocked
shaped to sweep now but the length wasn't there so he improvised a block
flighted on middle and flicked to square leg
just over short third man. An iffy stroke but e gets away with it. Tossed up on middle, Jp top-edges his reverse sweep, just over third man. Three more
nicely driven to long-off, with the turn
fired in on middle, bunted to long-on
nice batting. Opens the face, as late as possible, to guide to point
driven to long-on
nice stop. Hit towards ,mid-on but Maxwell scurries across to stop the ball from passing
steered to third man
flat and full and blocked
blocked off the front foot

bowled im. Massive wicket. AB is gone. Full on off, tails back in just enough to beat AB's bat. He tried to open the face to guide to third man but the ball jagged back just enough to go through his defences. Huge wicket this.
fullish on middle, pushed to mid-on
full again outside off, Behardien blocks
shortish delivery on middle, Behariden hurries on his toes to flick to square leg
quite full, looking to get one through again, Pushed to mid-on
full again to finish. A maiden as Behardien pushes to mid-off
shortish outside off, shovelled towards midwicket for three. well played from Duminy. 100 up
some flight on off and Behardien lunges forward to defend
nicely bowled. Flight outside off, squeezed to long-on
shorter and slower towards outside off, patted towards point
more flight on off, Duminy lunges forward to defend
nice bowling again, closer towards middle and leg but Duminy offers another dead bat to defend
full and straight, going wider of the crease. Pushed to short mid-on. Good lines, attacking those stumps
shorter delivery on middle, Behardien nudges towards backward square leg for a couple. Placed that well
clipped to square leg. Strays in line
a loose stroke. Fullish and wide, some away shape. Duminy wafts but is beaten
inside-edged to the keeper. Full and wide, Duminy drives but doesn't quite connect. Good bowling

bowled im. SA in tatters. NCN again. An absolute beauty. Not much he could have done actually. A good length delivery on off, straightens just enough to beat Duminy's bat. Uproots off stump. NCN defeated AB with one that jagged back in, beats Duminy with the away going one. Splendid bowling
flight outside off, pushed to cover
slightly shorter on middle, Behardien rocks back to clip to square leg
shorter and wide, a free delivery for Parnell to slap to deep cover.
nice batting. Goes deep and then clips to square leg, intentionally in front of midwicket
ripping turn. Slower and wider outside off, the ball grips and beats the bat
flight on off, Parnell presses forward to defend
good length on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
almost got one under the bat. Overpitched on middle, Behardien jams it out
the shot AB was trying to play. Fullish outside off, tapped to point
full and straight, attacking the stumps but Behardien's defensive technique interferes
dabbed to point again
yorker, well-executed but the line is well outside off. Behardien fails to get bat on this
drift and flight on leg, Parnell digs this out
flight on middle, Parnell pushes to cover. A lull in play
slightly shorter outside off, Parnell rushes on the back foot to cut to point
driven with the turn to long-off
flight on middle, Behardien rushes to the pitch and then drives back to the bowler
edged away. Short and wide from Lyon, Behardien goes back late and gets a thick outside edge which races away to the third man boundary
full from around the wicket, and straight. Flicked to midwicket

got im. One more. Another batsman's off stump goes for a jolly walk. Kept very low. Full on off, Parnell presses forward to that and planted his bat down the line but the ball pitched and kept low enough to creep under the bat. Clattered into off stump. SA six down
full and wide, left alone but some discernible inward movement after the ball left the bat
full and straight, honing in on that off stump. Defended
blocked out from the front foot
shot! Too full from Lyon outside off, Behardien lays into the drive and finds the gap through cover. Played that against the turn
flat on off, FB goes back to work to square leg. A good single
tossed up on off, blocked with a straight bat, hit the toe-end
nudged to short fine leg
fullish and straight, nurdled to short fine leg again
and again. Phangiso finds fine leg
overpitched on off, driven to mid-on
more inward movement. Not sharp but enough. On off and hit to cover from the front foot
nicely driven. Didn't look to overhit that, just timed a drive through extra cover for three.
full and straight, solidly and confidently blocked
defended off the front foot again. No real intent to look for runs
looking for the yorker but misses his length. A full toss is driven to mid-on
tossed up outside off, pushed in front of point for a run
outside off and shovelled to long-on. Well played
flight on off, defended
whipped away to square leg
tossed up on off, defended
flatter on off, confidently punched to long-on. Well played
ooh, beaten. Full and wide, Phangiso plays a bit late and the fullish delivery goes past
shortish on middle, Phangso fends off to fine leg
lazy, sloppy. Unlike Aus. One extra. Full on middle, driven to mid-on. Zampa's throw bounces just in front of Wade who cannot collect
full and straight, defended
good length on middle, defended to midwicket
shortish and wide, chopped towards point for one
a long-hop outside off, Behardien rocks back and swats over midwicket, on the bounce. Picked the length early and hit it over midwicket, didn't bother keeping it down
flat on off, smother-pulled to midwicket
nice comeback. The flatter delivery on off, defended by FB
lots of flight down leg, worked to midwicket
shortish and wide, chopped to point. By the time deep cover gets to the ball, the pair get two
good end. Tossed up on off and defended
full and angled in on off from over the stumps, Phangiso tips forward and blocks it with a straight bat
this does not bounce at all! Full and shoots low on middle, the batsman goes low with it to jam it out
NCN goes wide of the crease and angles it on the legs, clipped to square leg
digs a short ball outside off, but it does not rise much, Phangiso gets on top of the bounce and fends to short third man
wicket-to-wicket line, another one stays low, jabbed to short midwicket
FB uses his feet, the bowler pulls his length back on off. Quietly played back to NCN
backs away and pushes the short ball to the covers
tossed full on off and breaks away, induces an outside edge that rolls to short third man
fired full on middle, dug out to cover
legbreak, shoots low outside off, beats the batsman, dips and beats Wade as well
down the track and driven to long-off for one

slider, hits the pad, not given by ump Illingworth. Smith wants a review. It's a legal ball. Did it pitch in line? It pitched on leg but tracker shows that it was nipping down leg. Phangiso survives and sips some drinks
NCN tests FB with a bouncer, he ducks and avoids it
little offcutter on off, check-pushed back to the bowler
full and angled in on off, tapped in front of mid-off for an urgent single
too straight in line, picked away past square leg
back of a length and angled in, FB slides back in the crease and defends it in front of his toes
keeps alarmingly low on off, FB squirts it behind the wicket. He examines the toe end of the bat
flighted on off, Phangiso gets forward and smothers it
shorter and outside off, rocks back and chops to Maxi at short extra cover
legbreak, dabbed in front of point
drifts full on to the leg stump, squeezed out to cover
full and dips on middle, jammed back to Zampa
shorter legbreak outside off, cut to sweeper cover on the back foot
fuller and outside off, runs it to point off the face
back of a length and angled in, defended to short midwicket
length ball on a fourth-stump line, patted back to the bowler on the front foot
overpitched and outside off, stops on Phangiso. Check-driven in front of short extra cover
whipped from off stump to the left of diving square leg
rising short ball outside off, FB hops and rides it down to third man
slides on off from round the stumps, FB moves around in the crease and chops to short third man. Sets off for a risky one
breaks in to the pads on a shorter length, punched to long-on
down the track and flicked to Smith at short midwicket
floater on off, forward and smothered onto the pitch
FB steps outside leg, Lyon follows him with an offbreak, squirted onto the pad off an inside edge
quicker full ball on the leg stump, glanced to fine leg
full and aimed at off, played to mid-of
full and angled in, pushed to mid-off again
offcutter on middle, this is bunted to the right of mid-off now
short and wide outside off, FB frees his arms and slashes a cut through point. There is nobody sweeping the off-side boundary
picked off the pads to short midwicket
veering into the pads again, the batsman helps it to fine leg
paddled behind square
lobs this full ball on middle, heaved to mid-on

Phangiso goes for another wild heave. He makes a mess of it and holes out to long-off. Tosses a legbreak. The batsman goes low for a slog-sweep. He skews it into the hands of Hazlewood. FB shakes his head at the non-striker's end
follows it with another loopy legbreak, dabbed to the covers
Zampa whirls down a quicker ball, kept out
short legbreak leaves the left-hander, chopped to the covers
angled into the pads from around the wicket, nudged to mid-on
back of a length and angled on the leg stump, dabbed to mid-on again
back of a length and angled in on middle, Rabada gets behind the line and covers it
full and angled in on middle, defended to short midwicket
full and shoots low to ping the pad, but this was heading down leg
back of a length and angled in on middle, defended to mid-off. Another maiden for Hazlewood
full legbreak outside off, driven to sweeper cover
shorter legbreak, slapped to sweeper cover on the back foot
picked away to the leg-side sweeper
blockhole ball, blocked back
quick and full on middle, defended back again
keeps low and turns away from the left-hander, he skips back, prods and misses
length and angled in, chopped to the right of the keeper from the crease
full and angled into FB. He drills it back to the bowler. Hazlewood goes with both hands, but it slips out. Dropped
short on off, hangs back and turns to midwicket
jabbed to sweeper cover from outside off
overpitched on off, driven to mid-off
length and outside off, Rabada swishes and toe-ends it over the covers. Hazlewood finishes with 2 for 20
slid through on off, poked to cover
full and outside off, driven to long-off
tossed on middle, stabbed to cover
slider on middle, knocked to leg
down the track and drills a drive to long-on
googly leaves Rabada outside off, he perhaps picked it off the pitch, dabbing towards short third man
full and shoots low outside off from round the wicket. KG cuts and misses
Marsh goes wide of the crease and angles it in. Fuller length. KG stands tall and it sticks in the surface. Check-pushed to left of short extra cover
down the track, meets a full toss, and mis-times a drive to short extra cover
short and wide outside off, FB misses out. Slashed only to short extra cover
full on middle, eased to long-on
back of a length and stops on off, pushed to long-off
legbreak rips outside off, past the outside edge
another legbreak, KG keeps back and angles it to short third man
spinning down leg, wide
loopy and full on middle, driven to long-on
googly outside off, KG aims to bash it over the covers. He has to settle with a sliced outside edge to short third man
short on off, punched to short extra cover
half-tracker on off, FB  winds up and pulls it with authority over midwicket for six. It kept low but FB found the sweet spot on the bat. That strike raises his half-century
full and outside off, swung to long-off
tucked off the hips through square leg
slower short ball outside off, shovelled to long-on
full and outside off, flat-batted to long-off
full ball on off, slogged in the air to the left of a flying Smith at short midwicket, to long-on
cutter outside off, dabbed to the off side for one
full and outside off from round the stumps, sliced to long-off for two
too full on middle, belted to the left of long-on
dangled outside off, carved over extra cover
bowled'em. End of a fighting innings from FB. Tossed full and straight, FB bends for a reverse paddle. He misses and is nutmegged. Timbaaaah!
Tahir out! He runs down the track right away and runs out to the change room. He swings and slices it down the throat of NCN at long-off
short on the leg stump, hacked away to cow corner. Hat-trick averted

inn2.comm: starts with a leg side-ish delivery and Warner happily tucks behind square for one
good length on off, jags back in and Finch defends from the crease
nice bowling. Full and wide outside off, some away shape. Finch strides forward to defend
full length again outside off, a half-prod to point. Good start for Rabada
overpitched outside off, easily driven but straight to short cover
good end. Back of a length on off and solidly defended by Finch
a sixth-stump line outside off, Warner backs away ever so slightly to make room and cut to point. Exceptional feet movement
some swing, not a lot but enough. Fullish and wide outside off, tapped to point
fullish outside off, Warner shovels a flick to mid-on

got im. Big wicket. Parnell gets the big fish. He isn't bothering with the review. Huge breakthrough. Fullish on middle and leg, the ball jags back and hits Warner flush in front of leg. Umpire's call was the likely outcome, if Warner reviewed.
full on off, flicked to mid-on
shortish outside off, not the pitch to be pulling emphatically but Khawaja tries to no success
a good length on off, Finch blocks from the front foot
keeps a bit low. 139 kph, fullish on off, whipped confidently to midwicket
overpitched outside off, toe-ended to mid-off
driven into the off side
a bit leg side-ish. Missed a routine flick, an optimistic appeal is struck down. Finch has to try to get runs of these
a low full toss outside off, squirted to mid-on. Another maiden
make it 18. Back of a length outside off, blocked towards mid-on
too straight and tucked towards midwicket for a run
poor run. Misjudged. Fullish outside off, driven to mid-off where AB is lurking. So quick on the ball and releases, misses the stumps at the bowler's end. Out with a direct hit
Khawaja shuffles across dangerously to off, gets some bat on his nudge otherwise that could have been lbw
Finch opens the face to guide to third man. That was nicely played
another good over. Quite full on off and driven back to the bowler
short and smashed. Back of a length outside off, Finch stands tall and swats it over midwicket. Disdain
opens the face to guide to third man

bowled im. Another big wicket. Khawaja is beaten and SA have struck. Overpitched on off and middle, hustles Khawaja for pace who gets his angled bat down too late. The ball clips the pads and then clatters into the stumps
nice and full first up, Smith shuffles across and nudges to square leg
guided down to third man. Opened the face
a bit of width and scythed away but JP stops the boundary with a good dive. Nice stuff from SA so far
oh yes. Awesome timing. Fullish outside off, Smith transfers his weight forward as he drives and times the pants off it. Whistles past cover for a couple. Just a block
good adjustment. Shortish on off, chopped towards gully
nice shot. Manufactures a run by walking towards the ball and flicks to mid-on
overly full outside off, blocked

punched into the short cover region and sets off for a run. Rilee fields well, turns around and badly misses a throw to the bowler's end. Turned blindly did Rossouw, had more time than he thought he had
dabbed to backward point for one. Well played again. Really good
a naughty full toss on middle, punched to mid-off where AB picks up and fires the stumps down at the bowler's end. Smith is easily in
another full toss, was the googly. Drilled to the bowler
swept from an off-stump line to short fine leg
flat on middle, Finch was shaping to sweep but bailed out, block to midwicket
slower, shorter and wider. Slapped to long-off
a googly on off, a thick inside edge to square leg for a single
shot. Flicks the ball to fine leg from off stump. Wow, what power in those wrists
cramps Finch for room with a good length delivery on off, blocked
not short enough to pull on this surface. Keeps low and the ball beats Finch's pull. Kept ominously low, just over off stump
drifts down leg, pings off the pad to fine leg for a single

another wicket. Huge one again. But Smith reviews. Fullish on off, Smith shuffled across and missed a flick. The ball strikes him right in front of middle and leg. Looks out. No bat either. Australia in big trouble now. All reds and Smith is gone.
good length outside off, defended by Maxi
shot! Overpitched googly outside off and Finch muscles the drive past cover. Once he found the gap, twas always going to be four
a full toss on middle, drilled to mid-on and a cry of anguish from Finch
good fielding from AB. Another full toss is smashed towards mid-on, AB scampers across to field
shortish legbreak outside off, pummeled to long-off
the googly. Not picked. Finch went bat to cut but the variation came in and almost got through. Just about got bat down on it
shortish and wide, chopped to point
fullish on off, a thick outside edge to third man for a run
what do I know? Slightly too full on off, Finch sees the opportunity and lays into it with a powerful lofted drive over mid-on. Screams over the boundary
just past cover. Very streaky. Not a great shot. Full again, Finch opens the face and drives uppishly. Just wide of cover. May have got there too early
adjusts the length. Shortens it on off, blocked
overpitched outside off, the ball sneaks past the outside edge
a high full toss outside off, Finch times it to Rossouw at short cover who stops it with a dive
tossed up on off, Maxwell clears his pad and defends
short and slow outside off, extracts a bit of turn. Hit to deep point
tossed up outside off, skews off the outside edge to short third man
wow, what timing. flight on off, Finch opens up the bat face and lifts it with the spin over cover. Fantastic shot
flat on leg, a leading edge bounces back to the bowler
nurdled to square leg. Too straight there. Good batting from Finch
yorker first up, too much flight. Blocked

huge appeal, not given. AB reviews. Flat delivery outside off, Finch strides forward and is beaten on the inside edge by a ripping legbreak. Struck him in front of middle, may be too much turn. No bat. Likelihood of this sliding down leg. Umpire's call on wickets. That was close. Finch gets away with it. SA lose their review, their best review of the day.
too full and driven to long-on
tossed up on off, driven to mid-off.

given this time. This one did not look out. But Umpire Joel Wilson gives him. Flat legbreak is sliding down leg, but Shamsi and co. don't care. He has a wicket in his first over on his debut. Maxwell's struggles continue
poor delivery. Looking for too much, starts it too straight and Marsh flicks to the fine leg boundary
flat on off, defended
another flat delivery on middle, Finch goes back to defend
slider on off, almost goes through, Finch gets his bat down in time
short and wide, slapped to deep cover
flight on off, blocked off the front foot
slowish and wide, pushed towards deep cover for one
flat on middle, comes back in and pushed to cover
another massive appeal, not out this time. Much flatter, the legbreak rips back in again but it looked like Finch got outside the line on that. Shamsi causing plenty of troubles
low full toss, swept powerfully to deep square leg
the googly down leg, strikes Marsh on the back pad but pitched outside leg/. Another big appeal
much fuller outside off, squirted back
phew, this one slides past the outside edge. Marsh has no clue. Australia have no clue.
slow and straight, pushed to long-off
short and wide, scythed to deep point
ooh, rips past the outside edge after Finch's half-willed prod
shot. Vital runs these. Tossed up on off, Finch chooses to loft the ball and brings out exemplary timing and his power to lift over long-off
punched to long-on
flat on off, pushed to point
Finch gets down to sweep but misses, struck outside the line of off
ooh, should have been out. Amla misjudges the catch. Flat on middle, extra bounce takes Finch's top edge, lobs just over Amla who backtracked uncertainly. Did not pick it up at all
Finch persistent on the sweep, gloves to fine leg
overpitched on off, driven to mid-off
another big appeal. Finch gets low to sweep again, a bit of glove on that
another sweep. Nails it this time, right outta the middle. Swept behind square and Finch picks up four
flight on off, pushed to point
another Tahir full toss is driven to the bowler
outside edge and gone. Marsh is gone. A thick outside edge is gratefully accepted by de Kock. A flat legbreak outside off, Marsh tries to cut but gets a nick through. Big wicket. Aus five down now
tosses it full and outside off, Wade bends and sweeps it behind square
pushed through outside off, Finch had pre-meditated. He went low and swept behind square. Finch reaches fifty Australia 74 for 5
legbreak, Wade prods forward and defends it
lobs it full on middle and finds turn, Finch bends and top-edges a sweep wide of short fine leg

full and slower on middle, Wade aims to sweep... Scooped it. Nifty footwork from Qdk. He pre-meditated, pushed his right leg out, not in a right angle like Dhoni's karate kick. He ends up deflecting it to slip
spins in full, Wade takes it on the pad
massive appeal for lbw, umpire Wilson is unmoved. wrong'un from Shamsi, raps the pad. The tracker shows that it would have hit middle, Impact marginally on off.  Umpire's call
tossed and turns away past the outside edge. Sharp turn
fullish and sticks in the surface. Wade check-drives and it does not carry to the diving short extra cover fielder
played, Finch. Goes low, takes this googly from outside off, and sweeps nicely behind square
tossed on off, dabbed to point
fetches another one from outside off and sweeps to deep square leg
ripping googly, leaves the left-hander, beats the outside edge. Good bounce as well
pushed through on middle, Wade rolls his wrists on the sweep and sends it to long leg
skiddy full ball on middle, 98ks, turned to the midwicket region
back of a length and angled in on off, Finch covers up in defence
back of a length and swerved in, nudged to short midwicket
full and angled outside off, guided to point

Umpire Wilson's finger goes up. Rabada has Wade nicking behind! Australia six down and sinking. Angled in on a good length and leaves the left-hander outside off. 144.7ks, that Wade pushes with firm hands and edges it behind to de Kock
incutter from outside off, slices NCN into half. Zips past the inside edge
full and curves in, kept out. Top over from Rabada
zips through outside off, nudges 100ks, hits the pad outside off as Finch bends, sweeps, and does not touch it
flipper outside off, rushing ball. Flashes and is beaten again
legbreak outside off, beaten again. Strike three!
googly, sweeps and does not connect. Tahir hits the pad outside off
straighter one, punched down to long-on
wrong'un, curls in and hits the front pad. Not given. It was doing too much to hit the stumps. Snaking down leg
shortish on off, chopped to backward point
back of a length and outside off, helped down to third man
short ball on off, NCN presses forward in defence
inswinging yorker on middle, squeezed out
back of a length outside off, punched straight to short extra cover
141ks, inswinging yorker, too hot for NCN. It would have been too hot for any batsman. The leg bail is tipped off. Blockhole ball, NCN is beaten for pace. He can't bring his bat down in time
googly, drifts off the pad to short fine leg
quick fizzer outside off, jabbed through point
floated on middle, another impressive sweep from Finch. Placed fine of short fine leg
dragged from outside off to deep midwicket

ump Illingworth gives it. Googly, rips in from outside off, hits the front pad in front of off. Was that doing too much? Replays showed that the ball pinged the pad first before Zampa got an inside snick
sweeps and misses, strikes the pad outside off
short and down leg, Finch shapes to pull. There was a noise there. Qdk can't catch the ball
full and outside off, eased to short extra cover
back of a length and angled in on off, Finch hops and blocks
too straight in line, nurdled to square leg
overpitched and outside off, pushed to the covers
full and keeps low on off, played to backward point with an open face
legbreak outside off, sweeps across the line and misses

slider on off, short in length, Finch steps back and away as he chops it in the gap at backward point. Rossouw chases the ball from backward point, dives and lands shoulder first onto the ground near the edge of the boundary. The top of the shoulder rammed into the ground. He is down in pain. Amla runs across from short third man. The physio is out to tend to Rossouw. He is helped off the field by the physio. Has the right shoulder popped out? Rossouw clutches it and grimaces. It does not look good at all. Good commitment, he saved a run for his side, swatting the ball in before the ropes
swept away to square leg
breaks into the leg stump, inside-edged sweep onto the pad
shorter and turns outside off, reaches out and chops to the covers
ripping legbreak outside off, beats the outside edge
floated on middle and leg, swept in the air... wide of short fine leg
turns away outside off, swept to deep backward square leg
low full toss on off, swept to fine leg
misses the sweep now, hits the front pad outside off
puts bat on the sweep and sends it behind square for one
deflected off the pad to short fine leg
short and angled in, fended to short midwicket
short on off again, this is blocked past the bowler
incutter, slices the batsman into half and beats the inside edge, Kept low as well
short and angled into the leg stump, glanced to fine leg
angled in, Finch camps back and gets an inside edge past the leg stump
back of a length and angled in on off, cramps Lyon for room. Chopped in front of point
the batsman bends low to manufacture a full toss, swept to short fine leg
turns away, full around off, sweeps and misses
shorter and quicker, googly outside off, punched to mid-off
spins across the right hander and beats the sweep
swept straight to short fine leg
and again, turns in, swept to the same fielder
loud appeal for lbw, looks close. Arm-ball, snakes in with the arm, Lyon sweeps and looks like he has gloved it
Finch makes room outside leg, the bowler follows him with a turning ball, poked to point off an outside edge
94ks quicker ball, kept out
flat on off, chopped towards the covers
spins away from Lyon, dabbed to point
overpitched and outside off, forward and driven to short extra cover

Shamsi held this back outside off, got turn away as well. Dabbed wide of short third man. Lyon was struggling on the second run. The full-length dive saved him. And Lyon becomes the second Australian batsman after Finch to reach double figures
that looked close! Plumb, in fact. Shami has a wry smile.  Dangled up, straightens on middle, beats Lyon on the sweep and hits the pad in front of middle. Why was it not out? Replays: all reds!
Lyon connects with the sweep now and sends it past short fine leg for four
length and outside off, swept to square leg
Lyon and Finch keep sweeping. This is played over square leg
full and turns across Finch who dabs a single to short third man
slider outside off, punched back to the bowler
another quick fizzer, blocked on the back foot

Finch clears his front leg and holes out! AB pumps his fist and is mobbed by his team-mates. Finch stepped away outside leg in a bid to open up the off side. He is cramped for room by another quicker ball. 90.3ks. He ends up slicing a drive. AB dives full-stretch to his right at extra cover and pouches it
tucked off the pads through square leg
tossed and drifts in, Lyon misses the sweep
Lyon swigs his hands through a sweep and sends the ball square on the leg side
flat and turns into Lyon, punched down to long-on
full and breaks in, defended
googly, keeps low, kept out
legbreak, dragged down, shovelled to short midwicket
drifts in and turns away past the prodding bat
Shami floats it up outside off, Hazlewood flashes a drive over extra cover
nicely played. A flat delivery outside off, Lyon dabs it late to the third man boundary. Pulled back just inside, Parnell has a bit of hand while making contact with the rope says the third umpire
shovelled to long-on
googly on off, squirted to point
a darter on off, Hazlewood goes back to defend into the off side
superb shot again. Tossed up on off, Hazlewood drills a lofted drive to wide long-off where JP saves the boundary with a dive
the googly outside off, pushed into the gap at cover for a boundary. Nicely played by Hazlewood, looking as good as any batsman today
four more. Albeit of the legs. Strays down leg and it clips the pad on the way to the fine leg boundary
back of a length outside off, pushed to point from the crease
fullish on off, mis-timed to midwicket
punched behind point for a couple. Easily played.
back of a length delivery on leg, turned to square leg
full on off, Hazlewood backs out of the line, like a tail-ender, but defends comfortably
slogged away for four. Tossed up outside off, Lyon gets low and swats it into the gap at midwicket. Found a gap nicely
straight and given! South Africa secure a bonus-point win. Flat on middle and leg, Lyon misses his sweep this time and ump Illingworth signals the end of this game
